meanings.definition: A male falcon, especially a peregrine or gyrfalcon.
meanings.sent1: The tercels soared gracefully in the sky, hunting for prey.
meanings.sent2: I saw two majestic tercels perched on the tree branches.
meanings.sent3: The tercels decided to have a race to see who could catch the most mice.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were sharp like those of a tercel, always scanning the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The tercels' hunting skills were unmatched, making them the kings of the sky.

meanings.definition: The third part of a poem or stanza, typically consisting of three lines.
meanings.sent1: The poet carefully crafted the tercels of the stanza to convey a powerful message.
meanings.sent2: In the final tercels of the poem, the theme of love was beautifully summarized.
meanings.sent3: The tercels of the poem decided to rebel against the rhyming scheme and go on strike.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed seamlessly from one tercel to the next, creating a poetic masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The tercels of the stanza danced together, forming a harmonious trio of words.
